This DOES have sound AND movies. If either are not working, then it is your error not the upload's fault. Works 100% for me and I ran it exactly as directed.

** The solution for the no sound problem **
For Windows XP: 

Right click on the my computer icon and select properties. 
Select the Hardware tab and click the Device Manager button. 
In the device manager go down to Sound, Video, and Game controllers and click the plus sign next to it. 
Look for any devices that reference a Modem or Unimodem sound device. 
Right-click on this device and select disable. This device should now be disabled. 
and now the sound should work well!

tnx for ur help but i have Vista (waiting for win7).Nevertheless I checked in device manager but there was only ati audio device and soundmax.

** Sound solution for VISTA **
Go to Control Panel 
The click on ?Hardware and Sound? 
Click on ?Sound? 
Doble click on ?speakers? 
go to the Advanced tab 
Set the default format to ?24 Bit, 48000 Hz (Studio Quality)? 
Thats it!

I had a small problem changing the resolution in the game settings.

To adjust config options, copy/paste this location to access them.

my documents\my games\saw\sawgame\config

1.
Custom resolution, open SawEngine.cfg and search for ResX and ResY values. Change to what you want.

ResX=1920
ResY=480 

Game runs smooth on old pc:

Windows XP sp3 32bit, E8500 with GeForce 9500 GT.
